intro: Myrsine novocaledonica subsp. novocaledonica, commonly known as the New Caledonia myrsine, is a shrub native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an important component of the unique flora of New Caledonia.
